description: Installation of Solar PV panels on existing mansard roof; installation of air source heat pump to rear garden with associated pipework to rear elevation (in association with Listed Building Consent 2022/2219).
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Plant Noise</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development hereby approved shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least </span>10dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. A post installation noise assessment shall be carried out&nbsp; to confirm compliance with the required sound criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken as necessary and details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently maintained. The plant shall be serviced regularly in accordance with manufacturerâ€™s instructions and as necessary to ensure that the requirements of the condition are maintained. If at any time the plant is determined by the Local Planning Authority to be failing to comply with this condition, it shall be switched off and not used again until it is able to comply.</p><p><br></p><p>Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from machinery and equipment<br></p>

<p>Anti- vibration mounts&nbsp;</p><p>Prior to commencement of the development, details of anti-vibration measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council.&nbsp; The measures shall ensure that machinery, plant/ equipment, extract/ ventilation system and ducting are mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors are vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced.&nbsp; Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.&nbsp;</p><p>Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration.</p>

<p>Enclosures and sound barriers</p><p>Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council of acoustic enclosures around the proposed air heat pump. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and retained in perpetuity.&nbsp;</p><p>Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise.&nbsp;</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
